Edmond Soun

Hello, I'm Edmond! I am a full stack engineer and recent Rithm School graduate. Drawing from years of management experience, I strive to fuse my passion for all things technical with a people-first approach to the job at hand.

Experience

Software Engineer Intern

Rithm School
  • Developed Numbers API V2, a RESTful number trivia API, as a modular application using Flask Blueprints.
  • Worked in pairs to create tracking functionality for API requests using Flask after_request decorator.
  • Constructed web scraping scripts using Beautiful Soup to allow easy generation of new API content.
  • Outperformed story point estimations on sprints by an average of 20%.
  • Ensured all new code was thoroughly tested to maintain 95%+ coverage.
September 2022 - October 2022

About Me

Originally from Florida, I attended Reed College in Portland, Oregon, and received a degree in Russian Language with a focus on film translation. Curious minds can view a sample of my thesis work, subtitling the works of Soviet animator Vladimir Kobrin, here!

In 2015, I moved to San Francisco to pursue my interest in the makerspace movement, and to live a more authentic, out life as a transgender indivdual. I still volunteer teaching industrial laser cutter safety and operation at the San Francisco non-profit makerspace Humanmade.

In my free time, I perform regularly around San Francisco and produce Media Meltdown, a cult movie and media-focused drag show, out of the historic Balboa Theater in the Richmond district of San Francisco.

View a copy of my current resume here.
